thread.title: Palat goal gives Lightning OT win over Jets

title: Palat goal gives Lightning OT win over Jets
text:

Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Palat goal gives Lightning OT win over Jets Associated Press, AP 11:16 p.m. EDT October 23, 2015 Tampa Bay Lightning left wing Ondrej Palat (18) celebrates with teammate Steven Stamkos (91) after scoring in overtime against the Winnipeg Jets at MTS Centre. (Photo: Bruce Fedyck-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WINNIPEG, Manitoba (AP) - Ondrej Palat scored 36 seconds into overtime and the Tampa Bay Lightning beat the Winnipeg Jets 4-3 on Friday night. Palat scored off a 3-on-1 rush, converting a tap in after a tic-tac-toe play with Steven Stamkos and Victor Hedman. Braydon Coburn, Cedric Paquette and Vladislav Namestnikov also scored for the Lightning (5-2-1). Nikolaj Ehlers, Drew Stafford and Blake Wheeler had goals for the Jets (4-3-0). Ben Bishop has started every game for the Lightning this season and stopped 33 shots. Ondrej Pavelec picked up his third loss in five starts. Wheeler scored 1:17 into the third period to make it 3-3 with a shorthanded goal. He raced behind the net, stole the puck from Bishop and scored on a wraparound.
